[SYNTAX]: Awkward phrasing in "He further saw that work, although they themselves were not aware of it, alone made life liveable to them."
[SPELLING]: "liveable" (British spelling; acceptable but inconsistent with other terms in the text).
[STRUCTURE]: Overly complex sentences with nested clauses (e.g., "His peasants, grotesque as they may now appear to us, possess a fidelity [...]").
[LEXICON]: Archaic/obsolete terms (e.g., "betwixt," "unbroken by a single name") may disrupt modern readability.
